questions.text: Satisfying other peopleâ€™s (customers, superiors, etc) needs is more important to me than my own needs.
When working, I am interested in challenging tasks.
Climbing the career ladder is one of my most important professional goals.
I possess vast knowledge that is of great use in my work.
At work it is important for me to be considerate of the needs of my colleagues/employees.
I find it easy to make professional contact with strangers.
When I am convinced by an idea, I will get my way at work even if there is a lot of resistance.
I am said to be able to detect the reasons for a conflict easily.
I will only do someone a favour if they return it.
I always follow instructions from my superiors to the letter.
I am not inspired by the working methods of others, but prefer to keep to my way of doing things.
My colleagues can learn considerably from me.
I tend to analyse problems that I come accross from various perspectives.
I do not risk an argument, just to be in the right in professional matters.
I avoid social events with colleagues/employees.
I can easily put myself in the shoes of my colleagues and see things from their perspective.
Through my conduct at work, I demonstrate great practical competencies.
I am especially irritable during stressful periods at work .
I am happy to change procedure at work, if someone recommends a new method to me.
It is repeatedly confirmed to me by various colleagues that I exude self-confidence.
Everybody should be allowed to practise his/her religion the way he/she wants to.
When I am in charge of a group at work, I am not comfortable having to assert myself.
During negotiations I always try to see things from my counterpart's point of view.
My colleagues say that I am an especially talented networker, both in building and maintaining relationships.
I am more the specialist than the leader.
Most people can be trusted.
I have little interest in other people's needs and interests at work.
Assignments with challenging content do not appeal to me.
I am direct in telling my colleagues/employees what I think, even if my opinion could hurt them.
When working in a team my colleagues take my advice on board.
When there is a need to make new professional contacts, I am happy to make the first move
I understand intuitively what the needs and expectations of my colleagues are.
I trust my abilities, even if I make a lot of mistakes.
When an important decision needs to be taken, I carefully consider all the consequences of each possibility.
I take pleasure in having an impact on colleagues in relation to the goals set by the business.
In a professional argument I am the first to give in.
In order to achieve good results at work, I find out exactly what is expected of me.
I complain about colleagues/employees who do not take their work seriously enough.
It is said that I am charismatic.
I use tried and tested procedures to approach problems.
I really enjoy taking decisions.
I make sure I take a central position in professional networks.
I do not doubt my own abilities, even if I am openly and personally criticized.
Other perspectives and points of view enrich my life.
When taking decisions at work it is important to consider external factors, such as economic development.
When I am worried, it is better not to speak to me.
With regard to my work I have an in-depth/solid theoretical knowledge.
When a colleague achieves good results, I will always congratulate them.
I can assert myself successfully in all situations.
When I feel that colleagues/superiors do not share my opinion to a workrelated topic, I'll keep quiet.
When I meet strangers, I naturally assume that they are trustworthy.
I feel that some rituals in other religions are inappropriate.
My colleagues/superiors do not describe me as someone who is especially sociable.
I am a born leader.
I am dependent on others when it comes to solving work-related problems.
Conflicts amongst colleagues unsettle me.
I carefully consider the chances of success of various alternatives when making decisions.
I am more committed to the success of the team than to my own success.
When at work I do not have time to worry about other people's needs.
At work I prefer to keep to tried and tested methods than to try out new approaches.
I enjoy being the centre of attention.
I am not interested in getting a professional post if I would have to fight hard for it.
I take the time required before making a decision.
I often do not know how to handle problems.
One of my strengths is my ability to get over setbacks and failure fast.
When taking decisions in a group I have little interest in the opinions of the others.
In the past I have proven that I can handle unexpected situations easily.
I prefer to let others make wide-reaching leadership decisions.
I will not tolerate even small mistakes made by colleagues/employees.
I try to consider other people's interests when carrying out my professional duties.
I avoid activities which would require the building of a professional network.
At work I find it easy to get my proposals accepted, even when their is opposition.
I always help my colleagues when they are having problems.
When a work-related confict involves me, I do not make compromises.
I can behave aggressively without an obvious reason.
I aim to take a leading position in the company in order to impart my knowledge and experience.
I am aware of how I should behave in most social situations
I appreciate the company of others and need contact with people at work.
When I take a decision, I explain how it came about to the people concerned.
When mistakes are made I refuse to take any form of personal responsibility.
Most people say that I express myself in a clear and structured manner.
I always do everything in my power to guarantee the success of the company.
I am interested in challenging work assignments.
My colleagues say that I have the ability to assert myself appropriately.
I would rather give instructions than follow them.
In a work group there is no sense in wasting time listening to everyone's opinion.
When I have to decide to let employees go and have to carry this out, this can have a negative effect on my mood.
I make a habit of ensuring that the person I am speaking to has understood me correctly.
It is everyone's contribution that makes the company successful.
It is important for me that I am seen as a decent person in my professional environment.
I am known to be able to identify customer needs in a differentiated manner.
I have full control over my moods and emotions.
My colleagues respect me.
I especially enjoy being able to be of service to others in my professional activity.
I prefer a professional environment in which there is a limit to the amount of contact with others.
In conflicts I make sure the interests of all parties are respected.
I appreciate receiving advice as to how I can improve my work methods.
I am very nervous when I must hold a presentation in front of a large audience.
Most people have good intentions.
I am not a moody person.
It is said that I can motivate others skillfully.
I do everything possible to continuously develop my competences.
I especially appreciate having close contact with employees/colleagues.
I do/would not mind taking hard decisions regarding staff.
When people of different cultures come together, they enrich each other's lives.
When my professional opinion is not accepted by colleagues/superiors, I do everything I can to convince them.
Colleagues say that I contribute to a bad working atmosphere.
At work I would prefer to give a course, than to attend one.
It is one of my most important professional goals to take on leadership responsibility.
I am able to master my emotions in any given situation.
At work I express my opinions, even if I could hurt myself by doing so.
Sometimes I do not feel like going to work.
The idea of giving a speech to a large audience does not appeal to me.
Good-natured people usually get exploited by others.
I find many of the customs of my foreign colleagues surprising.
During conflicts with colleagues I put myself in their position.
I avoid professional situations in which I must approach others.
My colleague's bad mood has no influence on my own mood.
I would never betray my employer no matter what.
It unsettles me, when I am criticized personally.
I try harder to satisfy the needs of others than my own.
I would gladly participate in training that would enable me to learn about new topics.
In a team the group result is more important to me than my own success.
When making professional contacts I prefer others to approach me.
I do not avoid conflicts of any kind at work.
I am enthusiastic when new working procedures are introduced in my department.
Professionally, I am not always 100% involved.
I am often approached when the problem to be solved involves interpersonal relations.
I live by the motto: "Trust is good, checking is better"
One of my distinguishing strengths is my confidence in social situations
In discussions with colleagues/employees I speak more than others.
When I am being strongly criticized, this does not influence my behaviour toward my colleagues.
I often achieve professional successes because I correctly judge the expectations of others.
Others say that I am especially ready to be of service.
When my work methods do not lead to success, I will gladly try out new methods.
People call on me when a convincing communicator is required.
In the past I have tried asserting my opinion even in the face of heavy opposition.
I will intervene strongly in serious conflicts.
I am annoyed when asked to work overtime.
I can do my work blindfolded.
I have no difficulty arguing against beliefs that are diametrically opposed to my own outlook on life.
I am recognised as a person who can solve any type of conflict.
I am not especially strong in the theoretical aspects of my work.
I am not sure whether my company would support me come what may.
As soon as I recognize a (possible) conflict, I take a position.
When I want something from others, I always know exactly how to go about it.
I frequently talk with persons of different status, from different cultures or that speak another language, and I enjoy doing so.
Foreigners have to adapt their way of life to the mentality of the country they live in.
I find it difficult to judge how to behave in difficult conflict situations.
I do not leave anything to chance in my work.
In crises I often do not know which decision to take.
Even if I do not really know someone, I initially trust him/her.
I think it is great to learn about other ways of life.
Companies seek to exploit their employees.
The customs of certain foreign groups seem strange to me.
I can sometimes be mean/unfair to others.
Others say that I am very self-confident/self-assured.
I rarely criticise others because I don't want to put interpersonal harmony at risk.
It is important to me to involve others in my work.
I only help others if I am sure that they would also help me.
At work you shouldn't take a lot of risks; you should trust in proven methods.
I do my own work first and only then take the time to look after the needs of others.
Even if I have my own firm opinion, I will seek a compromise in case of disagreement
It is very easy for me to learn and apply new practices.
I have no problem putting trust in other people, even if I do not know them yet.
When the opinions/views of other people differ a lot from my own, I find it hard not to argue against them.
Most people tell me that I place a lot of confidence in them.
